keyTakeAways: Amazon Web Services experienced a massive outage on Monday, disrupting internet services that rely on its cloud platform.
The US has made moves restricting Chinaâ€™s access to semiconductor technology, raising concerns about global tech supply chains and innovation.
A three-part series on climate change highlights innovative solutions to address environmental challenges and promote sustainable futures.
Social media influencers misused algorithmic results to spread misinformation, demonstrating the risks of unregulated AI and digital content dissemination.
A new US law introducing transparency in tech regulation is considered 'light touch' and faces criticism for insufficient oversight.
A strategic move by a company in advance of trade talks with the US reflects broader geopolitical tensions in the tech and trade sectors.
Omar M. Yaghi, a chemist born to Palestinian refugee parents in Jordan, has been awarded a Nobel Prize, highlighting achievements in science from diverse global backgrounds.
An electric carmaker launched a new model to counter declining sales, signaling industry adaptation to shifting consumer preferences.
The deal between the ChatGPT creator and AMD gives the former the option to buy up to 10 percent of AMD, indicating a significant shift in AI and semiconductor industry dynamics.
Advances in AI-generated deepfake audio could lead to a surge in phone call fraud, exposing a growing cybersecurity threat.
The Nobel Prize in Medicine was announced on Monday, followed by five additional prizes to be declared over the next week, underscoring global scientific progress.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article covers a range of science and technology developments, including a major AWS outage affecting internet services, rising concerns over AI-generated deepfakes and misinformation spread by influencers, ongoing US-China semiconductor tensions, a strategic business deal between the ChatGPT creator and AMD, and a breakthrough in science with Omar M. Yaghi winning a Nobel Prize. It also highlights innovative climate solutions, electric vehicle industry challenges, and a new US transparency law that experts say is insufficient. These developments reflect global shifts in digital infrastructure, AI ethics, geopolitical trade dynamics, and scientific achievement.
title: Science and Technology | Today's latest from Al Jazeera
